records.location_details: A migrant was apprehended by Albanian authorities, taken to a camp, and then brought to the border near Kakavia to be pushed back to Greece. This occurred twice, with movements between Sarande, Gjirokaster, and the Kakavia border area in Albania, and Delvinaki in Greece.
records.where_clear: Albanian-Greek border near Kakavia, involving movements to Sarande and Gjirokaster in Albania, and Delvinaki in Greece.
records.location_text_raw: border near Kakavia, Delvinaki (Greece), Albania, Sarande, unknown camp near the border with Greece, border line in Kakavia, place near Kakavia, Greek border, Gjirokaster

possible_violations.legal_basis: Art. 4 of Protocol no. 4 of the European Convention on Human Rights

possible_violations.violation_name: prohibition of inhuman or degrading treatment
possible_violations.legal_basis: Article 3 of the European Convention on Human Rights

records.context_note: An interviewed migrant reported being apprehended twice by Albanian authorities, taken to a camp, and then brought to the border near Kakavia to be shown a path back to Greece. Tracking data from the migrant's phone and consistent accounts from other Serious Incident reports support the allegations of Albanian authorities transporting migrants to the border and instructing them to cross irregularly.
records.evidence_quote: an interviewed migrant claimed to have been apprehended twice by Albanian authorities both of which times he was brought to a camp/facility first and later to the border near Kakavia where he was shown a path to return to Greece by Albanian authorities.
